summary: Announcing participation at SmallSat Europe in Amsterdam on May 27, 2025, where Pablo Gallego Sanmiguel will join the 'Availability of Current and Planned Launch Capabilities' panel.

Announcing job openings for CNC Machinist, Metallic Coating Engineer, Propulsion Test Engineer, Manufacturing Engineer, Additive Manufacturing Engineer, and CAD/CAM Programmer for the MIURA 5 project. [cite: 6]
Specific job opening for a CAD/CAM Programmer to work on the manufacturing of MIURA 5 components. [cite: 7]
Spanish-language post announcing job openings for various engineering and technical roles for the MIURA 5 project, including CNC Machinist, Metallic Coating Engineer, and more.
Recruitment post seeking detail-driven CNC Machinists to manufacture precision components for space technology. [cite: 10, 11]
Announcing participation at FEINDEF, Spain's International Defence and Security Exhibition, alongside a recruitment call for Propulsion Tooling Engineers. [cite: 13, 15]
Seeking Propulsion Tooling Engineers to design and develop tooling solutions for the TEPREL-C engine production, supporting the MIURA 5 rocket. [cite: 16, 17]
Announcing their lead sponsorship of Space Camp Valencia to inspire children aged 10-17 with hands-on workshops, including a Mars landing simulation and rocket building. [cite: 18, 19, 20]
The 'PLD Space' business model has won the 2025 Case Writing Competition in the 'Bringing Technology to Market' category from IESE Business School. [cite: 22]

Completed the pre-selection of 55 students from over 800 applicants for the first AdAstra Early Talent Program; the next event is on October 16, 2025. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 25, 28, 29, 32]
Spanish announcement for the 'AdAstra Early Talent Day' livestream event on March 25th to present their high-impact internship program and professional development opportunities. [cite: 36, 38, 39]
Hosting a visit from Spanish astronaut Pablo Alvarez Fernandez, the Minister of Science and Innovation Diana Morant Ripoll, and leaders from the Spanish and European Space Agencies. [cite: 42, 44]
Hosted a delegation from the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Business, led by Alicia Varela Donoso, to present the MIURA 5 design, development, and manufacturing process. [cite: 46, 47]
Celebrating International Women's Day by acknowledging the talent and passion of the women driving the company's mission forward. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 49, 51]

Detailing the MIURA 5 manufacturing process, which combines proven technologies with cutting-edge processes like metal additive manufacturing, leading towards the first test flight in Kourou, French Guiana. [cite: 53, 56]
Update on the MIURA 5 SPARK program, having hosted a matchmaking session for 31 global teams, with the next step being the announcement of ticket winners by mid-April. [cite: 58, 62]
The company's running team participated in the 29th International Half Marathon and 10K Aguas de Alicante, promoting values like teamwork and effort. [cite: 63, 64]
Incomplete post with no discernible content.
Providing a link to the recording of their summer 2025 internship presentation event and reminding that the application deadline is April 1st. [cite: 65, 66]
Announcing job openings for Civil Engineers specialized in installations and structures for their launcher factory and test facilities. [cite: 68]
Showcasing their 12,500 m² headquarters in Elche, which has capacity for 400+ employees and can produce 6 MIURA 5 rockets and 60 TEPREL-C engines annually. [cite: 69, 71, 72]
Highlighting their contribution to 'Marca España' (Brand Spain) and an interview with co-founder Raúl Verdú in the 'Anuario de la Marca España'. [cite: 74, 75]
Holiday greetings from the team, followed by a recruitment announcement for technical positions at the MIURA 5 test benches.
Seeking qualified technical professionals for their Teruel test facilities, including Plant Manager, Pipe Welder, and Electromechanical Technician. [cite: 77, 79, 81, 84]

Update on the manufacturing of MIURA 5's primary structures using aluminum alloy 2014, followed by rigorous quality checks including X-ray analysis. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 88, 89, 90]
Received the 'Innovation Award' at #XIVNocheEconomiaeE from elEconomista and announced openings for qualified manufacturing technicians in Elche. [cite: 96, 98]
Spanish-language post seeking to hire qualified manufacturing technicians for the Elche factory, specifically a Welding Technician, CAD/CAM Programmer, and CNC Machinist. [cite: 99]
Announcing the selection of Deimos for the co-development of the GNC system for MIURA 5. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 100, 101]
Announcing participation in Space Tech Expo Europe, with a keynote on European Space Transportation and a panel on the micro-launch services market. [cite: 104, 105]
Their new 7-story MIURA 5 test bench is operational, enabling vertical propellant loading and structural compression tests to failure. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 113, 114]
CBDO Raúl Verdú provided an update on the MIURA 5 reusable rocket and the company's long-term ambitions at the 12th Industrial Days in Lampoldshausen, Germany. [cite: 117, 118]
Executive President Ezequiel Sanchez participated in a roundtable at #WIPBarcelona, emphasizing the need for competitive operators to regain European technological sovereignty. [cite: 120, 121]

Recapping a successful 2024, including growing the team by over 100 people, raising €170M in funding, opening a new factory, and advancing MIURA 5 production. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 122, 123]
Recap of the 'Beyond_by PLD Space' annual event, which presented the company's future vision and celebrated the anniversary of the first MIURA 1 launch. [cite: 125, 126]
Announcing a partnership with MIOTI | Tech & Business School to recruit talent for the MIURA 5 program. [cite: 128, 129]
Holiday message thanking team and partners, followed by an announcement for two key engineering positions for the MIURA 5 test facilities. [cite: 132, 137]
Recruitment post seeking a Piping Engineer and a Senior Piping Process Engineer for the MIURA 5 test facilities. This is a repost of a previous announcement. [cite: 137]
Unveiling a new brand identity, including an updated corporate logo and design system, to align with the company's ambitious growth plans. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 139, 142]
Hosted a visit from local and regional government officials to provide an update on the MIURA 5 program and discuss plans for industrial expansion. [cite: 143, 144]
Announcing participation in Aeroempleo - ETSIAE on April 8-9, featuring an 'Impact Talk' by their Chief People & Culture Officer. [cite: 145, 149]
Repost announcing participation in Aeroempleo - ETSIAE on April 8-9, where their Chief People & Culture Officer will give a talk on motivation and skills. [cite: 149, 150]
Seeking to hire a CAD/CAM Programmer and a Structures Tooling Engineer for their production department to work on Europe's leading reusable orbital launcher. [cite: 152, 153]
Announcing attendance at the 40th Annual Space Symposium in Colorado, with Pablo Gallego Sanmiguel available for one-to-one meetings. [cite: 155, 156]
Signed a launch contract with D-Orbit to deploy satellites to equatorial orbits, fulfilling over 80% of the MIURA 5 manifest until 2027. [cite: 160, 161]

Announcing the 'Beyond_by PLD Space' annual event will be livestreamed on October 7th, celebrating the anniversary of the first successful MIURA 1 launch. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 162, 165]

Teaser for the annual event 'Beyond_by PLD Space' on October 7th, which coincides with the anniversary of the first MIURA 1 launch and World Space Week. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 168, 170]
Expressing gratitude for receiving the 'Emprendedores' (Entrepreneurs) Award at their 14th-anniversary gala.
Hosted a visit from ESA's General Director Josef Aschbacher and other high-level officials from ESA and the Spanish government to showcase advancements on the MIURA 5. [cite: 173, 174]
Announcing the AdAstra Early Talent Day, a digital event on March 25th at 5:00 PM to present their Summer 2025 Internship Program for students and graduates. [cite: 178, 179]
Executive President Ezequiel Sanchez was featured on the podcast of strategic talent partner MIOTI, discussing the transformation of the space business. [cite: 182]
Announcing participation at Satellite 2025 in Washington, with Pablo Gallego Sanmiguel speaking at 'The Happy Hour Rocket Show' on March 11, 2025. [cite: 186, 187, 190]
Participating in Web Summit Qatar, with Mariano García speaking on the 'Qatar-Spain Innovation: B2B Success Stories' panel on February 25, 2025. [cite: 192, 193, 195]
Announcing the selection of Etlaq Spaceport in Oman as their second launch site to serve the Middle East market, with a third spaceport planned for 2026. [cite: 196, 197, 199]
Detailing how MIURA 5 hardware is tested under severe cryogenic conditions at the Teruel facility to ensure performance beyond flight expectations. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 205, 206]
Sponsoring the Small Satellites & Services International Forum (SSSIF) in Malaga as a Platinum Partner, with Cesar Bernal speaking on a panel about accessing space. [cite: 212, 213]
Announcing the company has grown to 300 employees, consisting of 131 engineers and over 180 university graduates from 20 nationalities. [cite: 215, 216]
Participation in the documentary series 'Calleja en el Espacio', where their CEO explains the challenge of launching Europe's first private rocket. [cite: 218]
Acknowledging the support of regional and local institutions (Generalitat Valenciana, Carlos Mazon, etc.) in advancing their technological roadmap. [cite: 221, 222]
Announcing participation in the 2025 SmallSat Symposium in Silicon Valley, where Pablo Gallego will speak on a panel about launch customization on February 4, 2025. [cite: 223, 224, 225]
Cesar Bernal, Sales & Customers Manager, will speak at the S4i | Science for Industry event on how the SPARK program is fostering innovation. [cite: 226, 227]
CBDO Raúl Verdú will participate in the 'Launching Europe into 2030' panel at the European Space Conference in Brussels on January 28, 2025. [cite: 229, 231]
The MIURA 5 second stage fuel tank has passed non-destructive inspection and is ready for testing in Teruel, with Stage 1 tanks to follow next month. [cite: 232]
The company's strategic plan is the subject of a new case study by the prestigious IESE Business School, focusing on decisions about vertical integration and service expansion. [cite: 234, 239, 240]
Promoting the MIURA 5 SPARK program, which allows students to submit innovation proposals to fly on early MIURA 5 launches, with a deadline of November 15th. [cite: 242, 243]
Hosted a visit from the director of the Government of Aragon and other officials at the Teruel technical facilities to showcase progress on the MIURA 5 test benches. [cite: 245, 246]
Secured an €11 million loan from COFIDES, part of a €16 million total initial investment, to develop the MIURA 5 launch site in Kourou. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 247, 249, 250]
The application stage for the SPARK program has closed, receiving 111 applications from 27 countries for no-cost launch services on MIURA 5's maiden flight. [cite: 253, 254]
Reached a milestone of 262 team members, growing from 200 in 6 months, and is currently hiring for over 40 roles. [cite: 257, 259, 260]
The SPARK program has received 108 applications from 24 countries, and the final application deadline has been extended to November 29, 2024. [cite: 261, 262]
Seeking an experienced Propulsion Test Engineer to support engine development and the continuous improvement of their test sites. [cite: 264]
Selected to join the European Innovation Council's EIC Scale Up 100 Club, which aims to accelerate the growth of its members into unicorns. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 268, 270]
Jose Andrés Sanchez-Bueno, Chief People & Culture Officer, will speak at FITEA on October 29, 2024, about building high-performance teams in the aerospace industry. [cite: 272, 273]
Chief Strategy & Public Affairs Officer, Anibal Villalba Fernandez, will speak on the 'DoD Launch Service Procurement Process' panel at the MilSat Symposium on October 24, 2024. [cite: 276, 278]
Pablo Gallego Sanmiguel will speak on the 'Launch: What Surprises Await' panel at the Satellite Innovation Symposium in Silicon Valley on October 22, 2024. [cite: 280, 283]
Hosted a visit from the president and general director of the Cotec Foundation for Innovation to showcase the MIURA 5 development and manufacturing process. [cite: 284]
Announcing participation at IAC 2024 in Milan from October 14-18, where the sales team will discuss MIURA 5 flight opportunities. [cite: 285, 286, 287, 288]
Selected by Endeavor's ISP panel in Dublin as one of their global high-impact entrepreneurs, becoming the first space startup in the network. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 290, 292]
Participating as a Platinum sponsor at New Space España on September 26-27, 2024, with managers César Bernal and Pablo Gallego Sanmiguel speaking on panels. [cite: 294, 296]
Co-founder and CBDO, Raúl Verdú, will speak on the 'Thrust and Trust: Enabling Space Transportation' panel at World Satellite Business Week in Paris on September 18, 2024. [cite: 300, 301]

Opening the SPARK program application for educational payloads from schools worldwide, with a submission deadline of November 15th for a chance to fly on MIURA 5. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 302, 304]
Inviting attendees to meet the sales team at SmallSat 2024 (August 3-8) to learn about MIURA 5 launch opportunities and the SPARK program. [cite: 308, 310]

Announcing the extension of the preliminary proposal deadline for the SPARK program to September 30th due to high interest from multiple countries. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 311, 314, 318]

Announcing €31 million in financing led by Spanish banks Santander and EBN Banco to develop the MIURA 5 program and expand industrial capabilities. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 326, 328, 329]

Congratulating the PoliTo Rocket Team from Politecnico di Torino for winning the first edition of their Internship Program Management Challenge at the Rocket Engineering Student Summit 2024. [cite: 331, 332]
Recruitment post seeking a Coating Technician to devise and apply coating solutions for the MIURA 5 launcher. [cite: 334]
Executive President Ezequiel Sanchez gave the keynote speech at the EDEM Escuela de Empresarios alumni event, emphasizing a long-term strategic focus. [cite: 335, 337]
Providing a Q&A support guide and an overview of the recently launched MIURA 5 SPARK Program, which offers no-cost launch services. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 338, 339]

Announcing the launch of the MIURA 5 SPARK Program, offering students, researchers, and companies the opportunity to launch projects on the first two MIURA 5 flights at no cost. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 342, 344]
Announcing a €10 million investment in the MIURA 5 Launch Complex at the Guiana Space Center (CSG), creating over 10 direct jobs. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 346, 348]
Co-founder and CBDO, Raúl Verdú, will participate in the #EUSpaceForum panel on 'Ensuring long term autonomous access to space for Europe'. [cite: 350]
Sponsoring the Space Camp 2024 scholarship program and creating a 'Build and Launch a Rocket' workshop for young people aged 10-17. [cite: 353, 354]
Executive President Ezequiel Sanchez will participate in the 'Space and Water' session at the Bankinter Innovation Foundation forum with NASA and SATLANTIS representatives. [cite: 356, 357, 358]
Selected to join the Leading Brands of Spain Forum as a Brand with High International Potential. [cite: 360]
Announcing participation in South Summit in Madrid, where their CFO will speak on a roundtable about investment in the space launcher industry. [cite: 361, 362]
Announcing participation in a panel on 'Diversifying Services' at Asia Satellite Business Week (ASBW) in Singapore. [cite: 365]

Announced a strategic partnership with Exolaunch to provide competitive end-to-end launch services for small satellites using the MIURA 5 launcher. Post includes a Spanish version. [cite: 366, 367, 369]
